intro: Asplenium oligophlebium var. iezimaense, commonly known as the Iezimaense spleenwort, is a rare fern species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds with a distinctive venation pattern. The plant typically grows on rock surfaces or in shaded, moist environments, exhibiting epiphytic or lithophytic growth habits. Its leaves are usually elongated and have a finely divided structure, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanical curiosity and subject of conservation interest.
